The current CEO of IBM is Arvind Krishna. He assumed the role in November 2020 after previously serving as Vice President and General Manager of the IBM Global Business Services division. He is responsible for managing the corporate strategy of the IBM business. He has been a lifelong leader in information technology, with roles in the financial services industry, software development, and cloud computing. He has also guided, mentored and grown hundreds of leaders within the business. He is also an advocate for lifelong learning, with a focus in the areas of collecting, converting and instantiating data. 

In this role, he is responsible for the development of a portfolio of products, services and platforms that are designed to help clients do more using the best of technology. He is driving new initiatives, such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, cloud, and cybersecurity, which are shaping the future of the business. He is a member of the IBM Cloud Council, and actively engages in the key challenges of AI and the Cloud. He is a member of the HISI technology council, and was recently elected as a director of the HISI International Executive Committee. 

As the CEO of IBM, he is focused on cultivating a culture of efficient, collaborative and resilient teams, responding to the needs of their customers, and delivering innovative digital solutions that meet the demanding expectations of their customers. He strives to grow, innovate and inspire his team, and work to develop and build positions of power and trust. He believes in empowering employees to have a voice in the company and taking pride not only in the performance of a single individual, but in the performance of an entire team. He is passionate about the development of the next generation of young people, and believes in investing in people, rather than technology. He believes in finding creative solutions to make the business run more effectively and efficiently, and utilizes his skills in communication, leadership, and innovation to achieve a better, successful future for IBM.

response_175:
The CEO of IBM is Arvind Krishna.  He was appointed in May 2020, less than two weeks after the death of Ginni Rometty, who had been IBM's CEO since 2012.  He is an Indian-American industrialist, entrepreneur and strategist. He is the President of IBM Global Business Services, one of the largest consulting and industry Solution and Technology businesses in the world. He is also the Executive Chair of IBM Global Business Services, and Executive Vice President of IBM Systems and Technology, and former Chief Technology and Engineering Officer and Chief Research Officer. He is also a member of the Board of Governors of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). Additionally, he is the chair of the IBM Open Innovation Summit and a member of IBM Foundation's Board of Directors. He is also the inventor of the Joy-Link technology, a tool that allows users to control their devices with natural human gestures. 
For more information on IBM's CEO and board of directors, visit www.ibm.com/about/contact.html#board.

response_395: The current CEO of IBM is Arvind Krishna. ARvind Krishna has been the President and CEO of IBM since 2017. He was also former COO, Corporate Chef, and director, Worldwide Strategic Marketing and Advertising. ARvind holds an AI MVP Award from the World Economic Forum‚Äôs AI Global Summit, as well as a Samequs Award for turning IBM into the phrase ‚Äúmainly IBM‚Äù. ARvind has a Masters in Pragmatist Philosophy, Engineering and Science and a Bachelors in Civil and Mechanical Engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. He is an active member of the MIT/i?vbe Initiative, the US-Saudi technology exchange, Muslim diaspora networks, and the 4th Stage Summit. ARvind is also active in environmental, arts, and humanitarian activities. He is a member of the World Wildlife Fund Global board of directors, the National Army HR Foundation‚Äôs advisory council, the Arts + Sciences Coalition, a member of the Montreal Arts Council and the South Bronx Experimental Lanscape initiative. He is also a founding member of EmergingGlobal.org. He was also chosen as one of the ‚Äú40 Under 40 Academy‚Äù of the World Economic Forum. ARvind is a talented musician and startup executive and believes that what defines a leader is not elegance of language, but sincerity of intent. ARvind values honesty, dedication, and hard work, and encourages public honesty and cooperation in an unprecedented era. ARvind also believes that kindness and empathy are remarkably rewarding, and encourage inclusivity. He also believes digital technology should be accessible to all, and aligns with IBM‚Äôs commitment to providing solutions that enable global health, connect people and organizations, transform industries, and create a more sustainable future. Still, ARvind embraces the mantra and goal of ‚ÄúIBM: Respect and inclusion for everyone‚Äù, and so and always promises to be there for colleagues, customers, and stakeholders. ARvind also believes that life has been made better with the help of computer science and tries to make a difference in the lives of families and societies, creating an added level of hope in people. ARvind leads a fascinating and inspiring life bringing his values and morals to every challenge and opportunity. He lives in Malad, Mumbai, India, Brows Pak, Ontario, Canada. He and his family follow a lifestyle of living life ‚Äúto the beat of the drum‚Äù and are always eating, laughing, entertaining, and learning from existing cultures. ARvind runs lifestyle photography sessions and enjoys photography, clothespin food photography, life storytelling, biking, and tinkering with electric cars. He also loves vegan food and believes everyone should plant a tree every year, if not more. ARvind will always look forward to what the future and his team will be doing together and taking down new records!
